metadata.title: CVE-2022-3526 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in Linux Kernel. Thisvulnerability affects the function macvlan_handle_frame of the filedrivers/net/macvlan.c of the component skb. The manipulation leads tomemory leak. The attack can be initiated remotely. It is recommended toapply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier of this vulnerability isVDB-211024.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic-64k - 5.15.0-35.36
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1008-kvm - 5.15.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1009-aws - 5.15.0-1009.11
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-35.36').

linux-gkeop package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1001.2').

linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1008.11').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-35.36').

linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1006.6').
